intro: Hydrocotyle cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' spurge laurel, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in umbels, and it produces berries that are edible for some animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
